019package com.bewsoftware.utils;
020
021import java.net.URL;
022
023/**
024 *
025 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
026 *
027 * @since 1.0
028 * @version 1.0
029 */
030public interface PackageInterface {
031
032    /**
033     * Return the title of this package.
034     *
035     * @return the title of the implementation, {@code null} is returned if it is not known.
036     */
037    String getImplementationTitle();
038
039    /**
040     * @return the vendor that implemented this package, {@code null}
041     *         is returned if it is not known.
042     */
043    String getImplementationVendor();
044
045    /**
046     * Return the version of this implementation.
047     * <p>
048     * It consists of any string
049     * assigned by the vendor of this implementation and does
050     * not have any particular syntax specified or expected by the Java
051     * runtime. It may be compared for equality with other
052     * package version strings used for this implementation
053     * by this vendor for this package.
054     *
055     * @return the version of the implementation, {@code null} is returned if it is not known.
056     */
057    String getImplementationVersion();
058
059    /**
060     * Return the name of this package.
061     *
062     * @return The fully-qualified name of this package as defined in section 6.5.3 of
063     * <cite>The Java&trade; Language Specification</cite>,
064     * for example, {@code java.lang}
065     */
066    String getName();
067
068    /**
069     * Return the title of the specification that this package implements.
070     *
071     * @return the specification title, {@code null} is returned if it is not known.
072     */
073    String getSpecificationTitle();
074
075    /**
076     * Return the name of the organization, vendor,
077     * or company that owns and maintains the specification
078     * of the classes that implement this package.
079     *
080     * @return the specification vendor, {@code null} is returned if it is not known.
081     */
082    String getSpecificationVendor();
083
084    /**
085     * Returns the version number of the specification
086     * that this package implements.
087     * <p>
088     * This version string must be a sequence of non-negative decimal
089     * integers separated by "."'s and may have leading zeros.
090     * When version strings are compared the most significant
091     * numbers are compared.
092     * <p>
093     * Specification version numbers use a syntax that consists of non-negative
094     * decimal integers separated by periods ".", for example "2.0" or
095     * "1.2.3.4.5.6.7". This allows an extensible number to be used to represent
096     * major, minor, micro, etc. versions. The version specification is described
097     * by the following formal grammar:
098     * <blockquote>
099     * <dl>
100     * <dt><i>SpecificationVersion:</i>
101     * <dd><i>Digits RefinedVersion<sub>opt</sub></i>
102     * <p>
103     * <dt><i>RefinedVersion:</i>
104     * <dd>{@code .}<i>Digits</i>
105     * <dd>{@code .}<i>Digits RefinedVersion</i>
106     * <p>
107     * <dt><i>Digits:</i>
108     * <dd><i>Digit</i>
109     * <dd><i>Digits</i>
110     * <p>
111     * <dt><i>Digit:</i>
112     * <dd>any character for which {@link Character#isDigit} returns {@code true},
113     * e.g. 0, 1, 2, ...
114     * </dl>
115     * </blockquote>
116     *
117     * @return the specification version, {@code null} is returned if it is not known.
118     */
119    String getSpecificationVersion();
120
121    /**
122     * @return the hash code computed from the package name.
123     */
124    @Override
125    int hashCode();
126
127    /**
128     * Compare this package's specification version with a
129     * desired version. It returns true if
130     * this packages specification version number is greater than or equal
131     * to the desired version number.
132     * <p>
133     * Version numbers are compared by sequentially comparing corresponding
134     * components of the desired and specification strings.
135     * Each component is converted as a decimal integer and the values
136     * compared.
137     * <p>
138     * If the specification value is greater than the desired
139     * value true is returned. If the value is less false is returned.
140     * If the values are equal the period is skipped and the next pair of
141     * components is compared.
142     *
143     * @param desired the version string of the desired version.
144     *
145     * @return true if this package's version number is greater
146     *         than or equal to the desired version number
147     *
148     * @exception NumberFormatException if the current version is not known or
149     *                                  the desired or current version is not of the correct dotted form.
150     */
151    boolean isCompatibleWith(String desired) throws NumberFormatException;
152
153    /**
154     * @return true if the package is sealed, false otherwise
155     */
156    boolean isSealed();
157
158    /**
159     * @param url the code source URL
160     *
161     * @return true if this package is sealed with respect to the given {@code url}
162     */
163    boolean isSealed(URL url);
164
165    /**
166     * Returns the string representation of this Package.
167     * <p>
168     * Its value is the string "package " and the package name.
169     * If the package title is defined it is appended.
170     * If the package version is defined it is appended.
171     *
172     * @return the string representation of the package.
173     */
174    @Override
175    String toString();
176
177}
